00049 #define __TBB_BAD_ALLOC reinterpret_cast<void*>(63)

00058 
00059     class concurrent_vector_base_v3 {
00060     protected:
00061 
00062         // Basic types declarations
00063         typedef size_t segment_index_t;
00064         typedef size_t size_type;
00065 
00066         // Using enumerations due to Mac linking problems of static const variables
00067         enum {
00068             // Size constants
00069             default_initial_segments = 1, // 2 initial items
00071             pointers_per_short_table = 3, // to fit into 8 words of entire structure
00072             pointers_per_long_table = sizeof(segment_index_t) * 8 // one segment per bit
00073         };
00074 
00075         // Segment pointer. Can be zero-initialized
00076         struct segment_t {
00077             void* array;
00078 #if TBB_DO_ASSERT
00079             ~segment_t() {
00080                 __TBB_ASSERT( array <= __TBB_BAD_ALLOC, "should have been freed by clear" );
00081             }
00082 #endif /* TBB_DO_ASSERT */
00083         };
00084  
00085         // Data fields
00086 
00088         void* (*vector_allocator_ptr)(concurrent_vector_base_v3 &, size_t);
00089 
00091         atomic<size_type> my_first_block;
00092 
00094         atomic<size_type> my_early_size;
00095 
00097         atomic<segment_t*> my_segment;
00098 
00100         segment_t my_storage[pointers_per_short_table];
00101 
00102         // Methods
00103 
00104         concurrent_vector_base_v3() {
00105             my_early_size = 0;
00106             my_first_block = 0; // here is not default_initial_segments
00107             for( segment_index_t i = 0; i < pointers_per_short_table; i++)
00108                 my_storage[i].array = NULL;
00109             my_segment = my_storage;
00110         }
00111         __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD ~concurrent_vector_base_v3();
00112 
00113         static segment_index_t segment_index_of( size_type index ) {
00114             return segment_index_t( __TBB_Log2( index|1 ) );
00115         }
00116 
00117         static segment_index_t segment_base( segment_index_t k ) {
00118             return (segment_index_t(1)<<k & ~segment_index_t(1));
00119         }
00120 
00121         static inline segment_index_t segment_base_index_of( segment_index_t &index ) {
00122             segment_index_t k = segment_index_of( index );
00123             index -= segment_base(k);
00124             return k;
00125         }
00126 
00127         static size_type segment_size( segment_index_t k ) {
00128             return segment_index_t(1)<<k; // fake value for k==0
00129         }
00130 
00132         typedef void (__TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC *internal_array_op1)(void* begin, size_type n );
00133 
00135         typedef void (__TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC *internal_array_op2)(void* dst, const void* src, size_type n );
00136 
00138         struct internal_segments_table {
00139             segment_index_t first_block;
00140             void* table[pointers_per_long_table];
00141         };
00142 
00143         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_reserve( size_type n, size_type element_size, size_type max_size );
00144         size_type __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_capacity() const;
00145         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_grow_to_at_least( size_type new_size, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 init, const void *src );
00146         void internal_grow( size_type start, size_type finish, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 init, const void *src );
00147         size_type __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_grow_by( size_type delta, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 init, const void *src );
00148         void* __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_push_back( size_type element_size, size_type& index );
00149         segment_index_t __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_clear( internal_array_op1 destroy );
00150         void* __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_compact( size_type element_size, void *table, internal_array_op1 destroy, internal_array_op2 copy );
00151         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_copy( const concurrent_vector_base_v3& src, size_type element_size, internal_array_op2 copy );
00152         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_assign( const concurrent_vector_base_v3& src, size_type element_size,
00153                               internal_array_op1 destroy, internal_array_op2 assign, internal_array_op2 copy );
00154         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_throw_exception(size_type) const;
00155         void __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_swap(concurrent_vector_base_v3& v);
00156 
00157 private:
00159         class helper;
00160         friend class helper;
00161     };
00162     
00163     typedef concurrent_vector_base_v3 concurrent_vector_base;

00169     template<typename Container, typename Value>
00170     class vector_iterator 
00171 #if defined(_WIN64) && defined(_MSC_VER) 
00172         // Ensure that Microsoft's internal template function _Val_type works correctly.
00173         : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag,Value>
00174 #endif /* defined(_WIN64) && defined(_MSC_VER) */
00175     {
00177         Container* my_vector;
00178 
00180         size_t my_index;
00181 
00183 
00184         mutable Value* my_item;
00185 
00186         template<typename C, typename T>
00187         friend vector_iterator<C,T> operator+( ptrdiff_t offset, const vector_iterator<C,T>& v );
00188 
00189         template<typename C, typename T, typename U>
00190         friend bool operator==( const vector_iterator<C,T>& i, const vector_iterator<C,U>& j );
00191 
00192         template<typename C, typename T, typename U>
00193         friend bool operator<( const vector_iterator<C,T>& i, const vector_iterator<C,U>& j );
00194 
00195         template<typename C, typename T, typename U>
00196         friend ptrdiff_t operator-( const vector_iterator<C,T>& i, const vector_iterator<C,U>& j );
00197     
00198         template<typename C, typename U>
00199         friend class internal::vector_iterator;
00200 
00201 #if !defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
00202         template<typename T, class A>
00203         friend class tbb::concurrent_vector;
00204 #else
00205 public: // workaround for MSVC
00206 #endif 
00207 
00208         vector_iterator( const Container& vector, size_t index ) : 
00209             my_vector(const_cast<Container*>(&vector)), 
00210             my_index(index), 
00211             my_item(NULL)
00212         {}
00213 
00214     public:
00216         vector_iterator() : my_vector(NULL), my_index(~size_t(0)), my_item(NULL) {}
00217 
00218         vector_iterator( const vector_iterator<Container,typename Container::value_type>& other ) :
00219             my_vector(other.my_vector),
00220             my_index(other.my_index),
00221             my_item(other.my_item)
00222         {}
00223 
00224         vector_iterator operator+( ptrdiff_t offset ) const {
00225             return vector_iterator( *my_vector, my_index+offset );
00226         }
00227         vector_iterator operator+=( ptrdiff_t offset ) {
00228             my_index+=offset;
00229             my_item = NULL;
00230             return *this;
00231         }
00232         vector_iterator operator-( ptrdiff_t offset ) const {
00233             return vector_iterator( *my_vector, my_index-offset );
00234         }
00235         vector_iterator operator-=( ptrdiff_t offset ) {
00236             my_index-=offset;
00237             my_item = NULL;
00238             return *this;
00239         }
00240         Value& operator*() const {
00241             Value* item = my_item;
00242             if( !item ) {
00243                 item = my_item = &my_vector->internal_subscript(my_index);
00244             }
00245             __TBB_ASSERT( item==&my_vector->internal_subscript(my_index), "corrupt cache" );
00246             return *item;
00247         }
00248         Value& operator[]( ptrdiff_t k ) const {
00249             return my_vector->internal_subscript(my_index+k);
00250         }
00251         Value* operator->() const {return &operator*();}
00252 
00254         vector_iterator& operator++() {
00255             size_t k = ++my_index;
00256             if( my_item ) {
00257                 // Following test uses 2's-complement wizardry
00258                 if( (k& (k-2))==0 ) {
00259                     // k is a power of two that is at least k-2
00260                     my_item= NULL;
00261                 } else {
00262                     ++my_item;
00263                 }
00264             }
00265             return *this;
00266         }
00267 
00269         vector_iterator& operator--() {
00270             __TBB_ASSERT( my_index>0, "operator--() applied to iterator already at beginning of concurrent_vector" ); 
00271             size_t k = my_index--;
00272             if( my_item ) {
00273                 // Following test uses 2's-complement wizardry
00274                 if( (k& (k-2))==0 ) {
00275                     // k is a power of two that is at least k-2  
00276                     my_item= NULL;
00277                 } else {
00278                     --my_item;
00279                 }
00280             }
00281             return *this;
00282         }
00283 
00285         vector_iterator operator++(int) {
00286             vector_iterator result = *this;
00287             operator++();
00288             return result;
00289         }
00290 
00292         vector_iterator operator--(int) {
00293             vector_iterator result = *this;
00294             operator--();
00295             return result;
00296         }
00297 
00298         // STL support
00299 
00300         typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00301         typedef Value value_type;
00302         typedef Value* pointer;
00303         typedef Value& reference;
00304         typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
00305     };
00306 
00307     template<typename Container, typename T>
00308     vector_iterator<Container,T> operator+( ptrdiff_t offset, const vector_iterator<Container,T>& v ) {
00309         return vector_iterator<Container,T>( *v.my_vector, v.my_index+offset );
00310     }
00311 
00312     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00313     bool operator==( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00314         return i.my_index==j.my_index;
00315     }
00316 
00317     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00318     bool operator!=( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00319         return !(i==j);
00320     }
00321 
00322     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00323     bool operator<( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00324         return i.my_index<j.my_index;
00325     }
00326 
00327     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00328     bool operator>( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00329         return j<i;
00330     }
00331 
00332     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00333     bool operator>=( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00334         return !(i<j);
00335     }
00336 
00337     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00338     bool operator<=( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00339         return !(j<i);
00340     }
00341 
00342     template<typename Container, typename T, typename U>
00343     ptrdiff_t operator-( const vector_iterator<Container,T>& i, const vector_iterator<Container,U>& j ) {
00344         return ptrdiff_t(i.my_index)-ptrdiff_t(j.my_index);
00345     }

00347     template<typename T, class A>
00348     class allocator_base {
00349     public:
00350         typedef typename A::template
00351             rebind<T>::other allocator_type;
00352         allocator_type my_allocator;
00353 
00354         allocator_base(const allocator_type &a = allocator_type() ) : my_allocator(a) {}
00355     };

00361 
00416 template<typename T, class A>
00417 class concurrent_vector: protected internal::allocator_base<T, A>,
00418                          private internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3 {
00419 private:
00420     template<typename I>
00421     class generic_range_type: public blocked_range<I> {
00422     public:
00423         typedef T value_type;
00424         typedef T& reference;
00425         typedef const T& const_reference;
00426         typedef I iterator;
00427         typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00428         generic_range_type( I begin_, I end_, size_t grainsize = 1) : blocked_range<I>(begin_,end_,grainsize) {} 
00429         template<typename U>
00430         generic_range_type( const generic_range_type<U>& r) : blocked_range<I>(r.begin(),r.end(),r.grainsize()) {} 
00431         generic_range_type( generic_range_type& r, split ) : blocked_range<I>(r,split()) {}
00432     };
00433 
00434     template<typename C, typename U>
00435     friend class internal::vector_iterator;
00436 public:
00437     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00438     // STL compatible types
00439     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00440     typedef internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3::size_type size_type;
00441     typedef typename internal::allocator_base<T, A>::allocator_type allocator_type;
00442 
00443     typedef T value_type;
00444     typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
00445     typedef T& reference;
00446     typedef const T& const_reference;
00447     typedef T *pointer;
00448     typedef const T *const_pointer;
00449 
00450     typedef internal::vector_iterator<concurrent_vector,T> iterator;
00451     typedef internal::vector_iterator<concurrent_vector,const T> const_iterator;
00452 
00453 #if !defined(_MSC_VER) || _CPPLIB_VER>=300 
00454     // Assume ISO standard definition of std::reverse_iterator
00455     typedef std::reverse_iterator<iterator> reverse_iterator;
00456     typedef std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator> const_reverse_iterator;
00457 #else
00458     // Use non-standard std::reverse_iterator
00459     typedef std::reverse_iterator<iterator,T,T&,T*> reverse_iterator;
00460     typedef std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator,T,const T&,const T*> const_reverse_iterator;
00461 #endif /* defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER<1300) */
00462 
00463     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00464     // Parallel algorithm support
00465     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00466     typedef generic_range_type<iterator> range_type;
00467     typedef generic_range_type<const_iterator> const_range_type;
00468 
00469     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00470     // STL compatible constructors & destructors
00471     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00472 
00474     explicit concurrent_vector(const allocator_type &a = allocator_type())
00475         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00476     {
00477         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00478     }
00479 
00481     concurrent_vector( const concurrent_vector& vector, const allocator_type& a = allocator_type() )
00482         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00483     {
00484         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00485         internal_copy(vector, sizeof(T), &copy_array);
00486     }
00487 
00489     template<class M>
00490     concurrent_vector( const concurrent_vector<T, M>& vector, const allocator_type& a = allocator_type() )
00491         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00492     {
00493         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00494         internal_copy(vector.internal_vector_base(), sizeof(T), &copy_array);
00495     }
00496 
00498     explicit concurrent_vector(size_type n)
00499     {
00500         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00501         if ( !n ) return;
00502         internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size()); my_early_size = n;
00503         __TBB_ASSERT( my_first_block == segment_index_of(n-1)+1, NULL );
00504         initialize_array(static_cast<T*>(my_segment[0].array), NULL, n);
00505     }
00506 
00508     concurrent_vector(size_type n, const_reference t, const allocator_type& a = allocator_type())
00509         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00510     {
00511         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00512         internal_assign( n, t );
00513     }
00514 
00516     template<class I>
00517     concurrent_vector(I first, I last, const allocator_type &a = allocator_type())
00518         : internal::allocator_base<T, A>(a)
00519     {
00520         vector_allocator_ptr = &internal_allocator;
00521         internal_assign(first, last, static_cast<is_integer_tag<std::numeric_limits<I>::is_integer> *>(0) );
00522     }
00523 
00525     concurrent_vector& operator=( const concurrent_vector& vector ) {
00526         if( this != &vector )
00527             concurrent_vector_base_v3::internal_assign(vector, sizeof(T), &destroy_array, &assign_array, &copy_array);
00528         return *this;
00529     }
00530 
00532     template<class M>
00533     concurrent_vector& operator=( const concurrent_vector<T, M>& vector ) {
00534         if( static_cast<void*>( this ) != static_cast<const void*>( &vector ) )
00535             concurrent_vector_base_v3::internal_assign(vector.internal_vector_base(),
00536                 sizeof(T), &destroy_array, &assign_array, &copy_array);
00537         return *this;
00538     }
00539 
00540     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00541     // Concurrent operations
00542     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00544 
00545     size_type grow_by( size_type delta ) {
00546         return delta ? internal_grow_by( delta, sizeof(T), &initialize_array, NULL ) : my_early_size;
00547     }
00548 
00550 
00551     size_type grow_by( size_type delta, const_reference t ) {
00552         return delta ? internal_grow_by( delta, sizeof(T), &initialize_array_by, static_cast<const void*>(&t) ) : my_early_size;
00553     }
00554 
00556     void grow_to_at_least( size_type n ) {
00557         if( my_early_size<n )
00558             internal_grow_to_at_least( n, sizeof(T), &initialize_array, NULL );
00559     };
00560 
00562     size_type push_back( const_reference item ) {
00563         size_type k;
00564         internal_loop_guide loop(1, internal_push_back(sizeof(T),k));
00565         loop.init(&item);
00566         return k;
00567     }
00568 
00570 
00572     reference operator[]( size_type index ) {
00573         return internal_subscript(index);
00574     }
00575 
00577     const_reference operator[]( size_type index ) const {
00578         return internal_subscript(index);
00579     }
00580 
00582     reference at( size_type index ) {
00583         return internal_subscript_with_exceptions(index);
00584     }
00585 
00587     const_reference at( size_type index ) const {
00588         return internal_subscript_with_exceptions(index);
00589     }
00590 
00592     range_type range( size_t grainsize = 1) {
00593         return range_type( begin(), end(), grainsize );
00594     }
00595 
00597     const_range_type range( size_t grainsize = 1 ) const {
00598         return const_range_type( begin(), end(), grainsize );
00599     }
00600     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00601     // Capacity
00602     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00604     size_type size() const {return my_early_size;}
00605 
00607     bool empty() const {return !my_early_size;}
00608 
00610     size_type capacity() const {return internal_capacity();}
00611 
00613 
00615     void reserve( size_type n ) {
00616         if( n )
00617             internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size());
00618     }
00619 
00621     void compact();
00622 
00624     size_type max_size() const {return (~size_type(0))/sizeof(T);}
00625 
00626     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00627     // STL support
00628     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00629 
00631     iterator begin() {return iterator(*this,0);}
00633     iterator end() {return iterator(*this,size());}
00635     const_iterator begin() const {return const_iterator(*this,0);}
00637     const_iterator end() const {return const_iterator(*this,size());}
00639     reverse_iterator rbegin() {return reverse_iterator(end());}
00641     reverse_iterator rend() {return reverse_iterator(begin());}
00643     const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const {return const_reverse_iterator(end());}
00645     const_reverse_iterator rend() const {return const_reverse_iterator(begin());}
00647     reference front() {
00648         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00649         return static_cast<T*>(my_segment[0].array)[0];
00650     }
00652     const_reference front() const {
00653         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00654         return static_cast<const T*>(my_segment[0].array)[0];
00655     }
00657     reference back() {
00658         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00659         return internal_subscript( my_early_size-1 );
00660     }
00662     const_reference back() const {
00663         __TBB_ASSERT( size()>0, NULL);
00664         return internal_subscript( my_early_size-1 );
00665     }
00667     allocator_type get_allocator() const { return this->my_allocator; }
00668 
00670     void assign(size_type n, const_reference t) { clear(); internal_assign( n, t ); }
00671 
00673     template<class I>
00674     void assign(I first, I last) {
00675         clear(); internal_assign( first, last, static_cast<is_integer_tag<std::numeric_limits<I>::is_integer> *>(0) );
00676     }
00677 
00679     void swap(concurrent_vector &vector) {
00680         if( this != &vector ) {
00681             concurrent_vector_base_v3::internal_swap(static_cast<concurrent_vector_base_v3&>(vector));
00682             std::swap(this->my_allocator, vector.my_allocator);
00683         }
00684     }
00685 
00687     void clear() {
00688         segment_t *table = my_segment;
00689         internal_free_segments( reinterpret_cast<void**>(table), internal_clear(&destroy_array), my_first_block );
00690         my_first_block = 0; // here is not default_initial_segments
00691     }
00692 
00694     ~concurrent_vector() {
00695         clear();
00696         // base class destructor call should be then
00697     }
00698 
00699     const internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3 &internal_vector_base() const { return *this; }
00700 private:
00702     static void *internal_allocator(internal::concurrent_vector_base_v3 &vb, size_t k) {
00703         return static_cast<concurrent_vector<T, A>&>(vb).my_allocator.allocate(k);
00704     }
00706     void internal_free_segments(void *table[], segment_index_t k, segment_index_t first_block);
00707 
00709     T& internal_subscript( size_type index ) const;
00710 
00712     T& internal_subscript_with_exceptions( size_type index ) const;

00718     template<bool B> class is_integer_tag;
00719 
00721     template<class I>
00722     void internal_assign(I first, I last, is_integer_tag<true> *) {
00723         internal_assign(static_cast<size_type>(first), static_cast<T>(last));
00724     }
00726     template<class I>
00727     void internal_assign(I first, I last, is_integer_tag<false> *) {
00728         internal_assign_iterators(first, last);
00729     }
00731     template<class I>
00732     void internal_assign_iterators(I first, I last);
00733 
00735     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC initialize_array( void* begin, const void*, size_type n );
00736 
00738     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC initialize_array_by( void* begin, const void* src, size_type n );
00739 
00741     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC copy_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n );
00742 
00744     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC assign_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n );
00745 
00747     static void __TBB_EXPORTED_FUNC destroy_array( void* begin, size_type n );
00748 
00750     class internal_loop_guide {
00751     public:
00752         const pointer array;
00753         const size_type n;
00754         size_type i;
00755         internal_loop_guide(size_type ntrials, void *ptr)
00756             : array(static_cast<pointer>(ptr)), n(ntrials), i(0) {}
00757         void init() {   for(; i < n; ++i) new( &array[i] ) T(); }
00758         void init(const void *src) { for(; i < n; ++i) new( &array[i] ) T(*static_cast<const T*>(src)); }
00759         void copy(const void *src) { for(; i < n; ++i) new( &array[i] ) T(static_cast<const T*>(src)[i]); }
00760         void assign(const void *src) { for(; i < n; ++i) array[i] = static_cast<const T*>(src)[i]; }
00761         template<class I> void iterate(I &src) { for(; i < n; ++i, ++src) new( &array[i] ) T( *src ); }
00762         ~internal_loop_guide() {
00763             if(i < n) // if exception raised, do zerroing on the rest of items
00764                 std::memset(array+i, 0, (n-i)*sizeof(value_type));
00765         }
00766     };
00767 };
00768 
00769 template<typename T, class A>
00770 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::compact() {
00771     internal_segments_table old;
00772     try {
00773         if( internal_compact( sizeof(T), &old, &destroy_array, &copy_array ) )
00774             internal_free_segments( old.table, pointers_per_long_table, old.first_block ); // free joined and unnecessary segments
00775     } catch(...) {
00776         if( old.first_block ) // free segment allocated for compacting. Only for support of exceptions in ctor of user T[ype]
00777             internal_free_segments( old.table, 1, old.first_block );
00778         throw;
00779     }
00780 }
00781 
00782 template<typename T, class A>
00783 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_free_segments(void *table[], segment_index_t k, segment_index_t first_block) {
00784     // Free the arrays
00785     while( k > first_block ) {
00786         --k;
00787         T* array = static_cast<T*>(table[k]);
00788         table[k] = NULL;
00789         if( array > __TBB_BAD_ALLOC ) // check for correct segment pointer
00790             this->my_allocator.deallocate( array, segment_size(k) );
00791     }
00792     T* array = static_cast<T*>(table[0]);
00793     if( array > __TBB_BAD_ALLOC ) {
00794         __TBB_ASSERT( first_block > 0, NULL );
00795         while(k > 0) table[--k] = NULL;
00796         this->my_allocator.deallocate( array, segment_size(first_block) );
00797     }
00798 }
00799 
00800 template<typename T, class A>
00801 T& concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_subscript( size_type index ) const {
00802     __TBB_ASSERT( index<size(), "index out of bounds" );
00803     size_type j = index;
00804     segment_index_t k = segment_base_index_of( j );
00805     // no need in __TBB_load_with_acquire since thread works in own space or gets 
00806 #if TBB_DO_THREADING_TOOLS||TBB_DO_ASSERT
00807     return static_cast<T*>( tbb::internal::itt_load_pointer_v3(&my_segment[k].array))[j];
00808 #else
00809     return static_cast<T*>(my_segment[k].array)[j];
00810 #endif /* TBB_DO_THREADING_TOOLS||TBB_DO_ASSERT */
00811 }
00812 
00813 template<typename T, class A>
00814 T& concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_subscript_with_exceptions( size_type index ) const {
00815     if( index >= size() )
00816         internal_throw_exception(0); // throw std::out_of_range
00817     size_type j = index;
00818     segment_index_t k = segment_base_index_of( j );
00819     if( my_segment == (segment_t*)my_storage && k >= pointers_per_short_table )
00820         internal_throw_exception(1); // throw std::out_of_range
00821     void *array = my_segment[k].array; // no need in __TBB_load_with_acquire
00822     if( array <= __TBB_BAD_ALLOC ) // check for correct segment pointer
00823         internal_throw_exception(2); // throw std::range_error
00824     return static_cast<T*>(array)[j];
00825 }
00826 
00827 template<typename T, class A>
00828 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_assign(size_type n, const_reference t)
00829 {
00830     if( !n ) return;
00831     internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size()); my_early_size = n;
00832     __TBB_ASSERT( my_first_block == segment_index_of(n-1)+1, NULL );
00833     initialize_array_by(static_cast<T*>(my_segment[0].array), static_cast<const void*>(&t), n);
00834 }
00835 
00836 template<typename T, class A> template<class I>
00837 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::internal_assign_iterators(I first, I last) {
00838     size_type n = std::distance(first, last);
00839     if( !n ) return;
00840     internal_reserve(n, sizeof(T), max_size()); my_early_size = n;
00841     __TBB_ASSERT( my_first_block == segment_index_of(n-1)+1, NULL );
00842     internal_loop_guide loop(n, my_segment[0].array); loop.iterate(first);
00843 }
00844 
00845 template<typename T, class A>
00846 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::initialize_array( void* begin, const void *, size_type n ) {
00847     internal_loop_guide loop(n, begin); loop.init();
00848 }
00849 
00850 template<typename T, class A>
00851 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::initialize_array_by( void* begin, const void *src, size_type n ) {
00852     internal_loop_guide loop(n, begin); loop.init(src);
00853 }
00854 
00855 template<typename T, class A>
00856 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::copy_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n ) {
00857     internal_loop_guide loop(n, dst); loop.copy(src);
00858 }
00859 
00860 template<typename T, class A>
00861 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::assign_array( void* dst, const void* src, size_type n ) {
00862     internal_loop_guide loop(n, dst); loop.assign(src);
00863 }
00864 
00865 template<typename T, class A>
00866 void concurrent_vector<T, A>::destroy_array( void* begin, size_type n ) {
00867     T* array = static_cast<T*>(begin);
00868     for( size_type j=n; j>0; --j )
00869         array[j-1].~T(); // destructors are supposed to not throw any exceptions
00870 }
00871 
00872 // concurrent_vector's template functions
00873 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00874 inline bool operator==(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b) {
00875     //TODO[?]: deal with _Range_checked_iterator_tag of MSVC.
00876     // Simply:    return a.size() == b.size() && std::equal(a.begin(), a.end(), b.begin());
00877     if(a.size() != b.size()) return false;
00878     typename concurrent_vector<T, A1>::const_iterator i(a.begin());
00879     typename concurrent_vector<T, A2>::const_iterator j(b.begin());
00880     for(; i != a.end(); ++i, ++j)
00881         if( !(*i == *j) ) return false;
00882     return true;
00883 }
00884 
00885 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00886 inline bool operator!=(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00887 {    return !(a == b); }
00888 
00889 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00890 inline bool operator<(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00891 {    return (std::lexicographical_compare(a.begin(), a.end(), b.begin(), b.end())); }
00892 
00893 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00894 inline bool operator>(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00895 {    return b < a; }
00896 
00897 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00898 inline bool operator<=(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00899 {    return !(b < a); }
00900 
00901 template<typename T, class A1, class A2>
00902 inline bool operator>=(const concurrent_vector<T, A1> &a, const concurrent_vector<T, A2> &b)
00903 {    return !(a < b); }
00904 
00905 template<typename T, class A>
00906 inline void swap(concurrent_vector<T, A> &a, concurrent_vector<T, A> &b)
00907 {    a.swap( b ); }
00908
